metadata.title: CVE-2023-28642 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
runc is a CLI tool for spawning and running containers according to the OCIspecification. It was found that AppArmor can be bypassed when `/proc`inside the container is symlinked with a specific mount configuration. Thisissue has been fixed in runc version 1.1.5, by prohibiting symlinked`/proc`. See PR #3785 for details. users are advised to upgrade. Usersunable to upgrade should avoid using an untrusted container image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

runc - 1.0.0~rc7+git20190403.029124da-0ubuntu1~16.04.4+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: runc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.0~rc7+git20190403.029124da-0ubuntu1~16.04.4+esm4').
